comments:
I have a web project for which certain objects are provided by a separate
project. By identifying the separate project as required, the web project
builds, but does not deploy because the exported binaries for the required
project are not included in the deployment.

Certainly, there are workarounds, such as adding a custom builder to move it
over, but that kind of defeats the point of having a required project.

Hi Can you elaborate?   What do you mean by deployment?

So you have a module depencency setup (Using the project property sheet)
And then you publish the war....   are you saying the server isn't finding the dep
classes?   or is it missing from the .deployables folder?

I have a dependency listed in the project property sheet for another Java
project. When I publish the war, the server cannot find the dep classes, and
they are not in the .deployables folder.

Hi Nash,
  I have used scenario as you mentioned, and put my classes in  the project 
called Util, then from the Web project->Properties->Java Jar dependency->Set 
Web library project dependency chose the Util  project, this
adds following entry in  the .wtpmodules for the Web component.
      

  <dependent-module deploy-path="/WEB-INF/lib" 
handle="module:/resource/Util/Util">
            <dependency-type>uses</dependency-type>
        </dependent-module>

I was  able to call  the classes in the Util project successfully from the 
Servlets in the Web project.

Hmmm. Apparently I'm missing some crucial step then. 

My util classes are in a normal Java project. When I go to the web
project->properties->Java Jar Dependency, the "Set Web library project
dependency" option is grayed out and the select list is empty with no way to add
anything.

I am getting an error, however, if I go to the Java Jar Dependency properties
sheet for my utility project. I don't know if it's helpful, but here's the
stacktrace from that:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.jface 4 2 2005-07-19 20:32:42.101
!MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in:
"org.eclipse.jface".!STACK 0
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0
        at
org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.common.ClasspathModel.initializeComponent(ClasspathModel.java:100)
        at
org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.common.ClasspathModel.setProject(ClasspathModel.java:94)
        at
org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.JARDependencyPropertiesPage.initialize(JARDependencyPropertiesPage.java:102)
        at
org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.JARDependencyPropertiesPage.createContents(JARDependencyPropertiesPage.java:174)
        at
org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferencePage.createControl(PreferencePage.java:232)
        at
org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferenceDialog.createPageControl(PreferenceDialog.java:1371)
....

For a standalone Web Project(not in the EAR), the option is grayed out, but 
the table lists all the Utility modules and the Java projects available in the 
workspace.

Is your Java Project configured properly?, and what is the build you are using?

I'm using Web Tools 0.7 RC1 with all dependencies exactly as listed.

The error in my previous comment occurs with any Java Project I create, even in
a brand new workspace.

Nothing I do causes anything to show up in the select list for my web application.
Derek can you verify this isn't still an issue with todays driver?

This is working in current builds....note you may have to do a clean build on 
the workspacce in some cases but that problem will be resolved in M8 when we 
moved from the .deployables builder to publish tasks
This change is a bulk update of all _un_targeted, fixed, resolved bugs upon release of M5. This particular bug _might_ have been fixed earlier than M5. (Feel free to correct).
